sentences.en: “spent the next three years in Italy, kicking around the country on a motor scooter”(&b{Charles E. Claffey})
sentences.cn: “后来三年在意大利开着小轮摩托车到处游荡”(&b{查尔斯E.克拉弗})

sentences.en: A sandstorm kicked up while we drove through the desert.
sentences.cn: 我们在沙漠里行驶时，沙暴加强了

sentences.en: Dave pulled a back muscle and could barely kick the ball.
sentences.cn: 戴夫背部拉伤，几乎没法踢球。

sentences.en: He kicked the door hard.
sentences.cn: 他用力踢门。

sentences.en: He lifted the bike off its stand and kick-started it.
sentences.cn: 他将摩托车撑脚架往上一提，开始蹬车启动。

sentences.en: He suffered a kick to the knee.
sentences.cn: 他的膝盖被踢了一脚。

sentences.en: He threw me to the ground and started to kick.
sentences.cn: 他把我摔在地上开始踢我。

sentences.en: He would barge into them and kick them in the shins.
sentences.cn: 他会向他们冲过去，踹他们的小腿肚子。

sentences.en: His ulcer has kicked up again.
sentences.cn: 他的溃疡又发病了

sentences.en: I don't feel that anyone can kick me around anymore.
sentences.cn: 我认为没人敢再欺负我了。

sentences.en: I got a kick out of seeing my name in print.
sentences.cn: 当看到我的名字印成铅字时，我感到无比兴奋。

sentences.en: I went to kick the ball and I completely missed it.
sentences.cn: 我去踢球却踢了个空。

sentences.en: In the end I just couldn't kick Jimmy when he was down.
sentences.cn: 最后我就是无法做到在吉米倒霉时落井下石。

sentences.en: kicked in a few dollars for the office party.
sentences.cn: 捐一些钱给公司的聚会

sentences.en: kicked off the promotional tour with a press conference for the author.
sentences.cn: 以记者招待会揭开了这位作家的书籍促销活动的序幕

sentences.en: kicked up a row.
sentences.cn: 起哄

sentences.en: Llamas won't bite or kick.
sentences.cn: 美洲驼既不会咬人也不会踢人。

sentences.en: Luton conceded a free kick on the edge of the penalty area.
sentences.cn: 卢顿未能在罚球区的边缘截住对方的任意球。

sentences.en: My kick wasn't half a bad effort for an old man.
sentences.cn: 像我这把年纪的人，老腿确实不听使唤了。

sentences.en: She gave him a kick on the shin.
sentences.cn: 她朝他的小腿踢了一脚。

sentences.en: She was forced to kick down the front door.
sentences.cn: 她只好踢开前门。

sentences.en: The boys were kicking a ball around in the yard.
sentences.cn: 男孩们在院子里踢球。

sentences.en: the competition will be healthy, but we needed a kick in the pants.
sentences.cn: 竞赛是有益的，但我们需要一点激励。

sentences.en: The engine finally kicked over.
sentences.cn: 引擎终于启动了

sentences.en: The housing market needs a kick-start.
sentences.cn: 房地产市场需要刺激。

sentences.en: The President has chosen to kick-start the economy by slashing interest rates.
sentences.cn: 总统选择通过大幅降低利率来重新拉动经济增长。

sentences.en: The shows kick off on October 24th.
sentences.cn: 演出10月24日开始。

sentences.en: They kick up a rumpus and throw things at each other.
sentences.cn: 他们吵了起来并互相朝对方扔东西。

words.tran_cn: 活泼热烈的；激动人心的
踢者；爱发牢骚的人；喷射器
踢；反冲；加速；活跃（kick的ing形式）

phrases.phrase: a kick at the can (或 cat)
a kick in the pants (或 up the backside)

phrases.tran_cn: 粗暴而轻率地对待；从各个角度考虑；流浪
考虑：对（一个想法）给予考虑
v. 解雇；开除；把球踢出界
(北美，粗俚)有力地干；粗暴地干
v. 戒除嗜好；戒掉习惯

trans.tran_cn: 踢，踢球，极度兴奋，刺激性

trans.tran_en: If you kick someone or something, you hit them forcefully with your foot

trans.tran_cn: 踢，踢蹬，生自己的气，射门得分
trans.tran_en: If you kick someone or something, you hit them forcefully with your foot
If you kick someone or something, you hit them forcefully with your foot
If you kick someone or something, you hit them forcefully with your foot
